title: Professional Service Specialist IV Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kean University
Interview Descriptions: Received an email asking my availability which came approximately 3 weeks after I initially applied for the position. I replied giving a date and time which was accepted…Set a date and within 2 days i was interviewed via zoom.
Interview Questions: How do you manage multitasking?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty laid back. It was conducted virtually. They asked about my experience and my hobbies. They also asked why did I choose their University. It is my Alma Mater so that was simple.
Interview Questions: What experience do I have in teaching?

title: Usher, Cashier, Box Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kean University
Interview Descriptions: There were basic questions were asked. It was not hard. It was only one interview and then they tell you if you got the job or not. Good experience overall
Interview Questions: What would you say are your weaknesses

title: Academic Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a very fast process and if you have the qualifications to show on your resume that you can do the job efficiently, they will strongly consider you. Try to answer each question as honestly as possible since it will help them in figuring out if you are a great fit or not.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kean?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kean University (Elizabeth, NJ) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was well organized and  the search committee explained well the expectations from the process and the position being searched for. The on-campus interview was also done safely, that also encouraged significant and meaningful conversation with current faculty, students, and other members of the university.
Interview Questions: How would you incorporate diversity into your teaching?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kean University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: First interview was via zoom, about eight people present for the phone interview which I wasn’t expecting. Second interview was giving a guest lecture followed by an interview. I followed up that week, and didn’t hear anything until I received a form rejection 4 months later. Interview was rigid a the whole process seemed impersonal. It was a lot of work to prepare, time off work and interviews to not hear anything from the department.
Interview Questions:
Why Kean 
Describe Teaching style
Plan on Service to university 
Describe Research abilities

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kean University
Interview Descriptions: The interview included 5 folks from around the campus. Part one included Phone and second part  face to face. Straight  forward. Nice people. Quick process, HR takes a bit of time to reach out.
Interview Questions: They request a demo lesson plan

title: Managing Assistant Director III Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kean University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was slow and sporadic; response times felt slower than other universities. Questions feel conversational and easy so you can prepare by looking online for general questions and some specific to the role. HR takes some time to respond.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Ellucian programs?

title: Supplemental Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very easy simple questions. They make sure you are comfortable and relaxed. I answered the questions with ease, and felt relaxed through the whole process. I recommend anyone who is interested to go for it.
Interview Questions: What made you want to become an SI Leader?

title: Student Assistant - Recreation Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kean University
Interview Descriptions: The interview for the recreation department was laid back and no pressure. The interview was held by the office assistants. About Ten Easy Questions were asked  during the interview
Interview Questions: If I asked your friends to describe you what would they say?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Conversation interview with the supervisor after applying for the job. Will be asked on past experience and skills. Very friendly casual interview which lasted for only 30 minutes. You do not have to be nervous about it.
Interview Questions: What is your plan after college?

title: Academic Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kean University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Practical and oral. Ask basic questions about my qualification, area of specialization in I.T and strength/weakness. If I can work under pressure, available on weekends and also be able to work extra hours if need be
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kean University
Interview Descriptions: Skype/phone interview, nice people. they tried to use skype first. there were network problem and didn't work well. then we switched to phone calls.  It’s great interview. They invited to campus visit after it.
Interview Questions:
why do you apply for this position? 
what courses you can teach?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy. they asked me who I knew. They took me up into a room, and they asked me a few questions and that was that. They were really nice!
Interview Questions: Do you know how to use an HDMI cord

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kean University in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straightforward.  Nothing that was too unexpected, granted they already had an idea on who I was. I walked in wearing one of my best shirts, extremely nervous because this was my first ever job interview and all they ended up asking me extremely easy questions. I was hired literally about 20 minutes later.
Interview Questions: Whats your greatest weakness?

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Kean University (Elizabeth, NJ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy and super chill. Boss was great the whole time. Be confident and trust yourself nothing else matters. So remember be yourself. Be honest and shower and dress nicely. Good Luck!
Interview Questions: Want it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kean University
Interview Descriptions: Mostly asked about me and what I was doing for school. Told me what the job would be like and said he would hire if I was passionate to learn.
Interview Questions: What do you do in your free time?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kean University
Interview Descriptions: It is the stuff called my if I willing to work on campus. Face to face Interview. I got the offer on next day. Easy Process. Nice Person. Great Experience. Why I need 30 words?
Interview Questions: Social Media Experience?

title: Vice President Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was first organized with a screening/ Skype interview and then an in-person meeting with the search committee.  The interview process was well organized with thoughtful questions by the committee members who represented a cross-section of the university.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were a mix of behavioral questions, job specific, and additional questions on how one would handle some of the challenges facing the university.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: A Kean adviser recommended me the job.  I emailed the director of media relations the same day and got an email back 2 days later to meet face-to-face for an interview.  Interviewer was very passionate about Kean and was very personable.  Asked to see some writing samples. (press releases, etc)
Interview Questions: What is some of your experience?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process is simple. You apply in person by filling out a questionnaire about previous jobs, basic personal information, major and year of graduation. Depending on when you applied, it will take a little  bit of time to get back to you. If you receive a phone call for an in-person interview, then you are on the right track. Two weeks after the in-person interview you will receive either an email or phone call about whether or not you obtained the role.
Interview Questions: Why do you deserve the job?

title: Biology Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I actually knew the Executive Director. He was my former professor so it was pretty informal. He asked how I was doing and my experiences. We reflected on his class. He offered me a class to teach and a week and a half to think it over. He is very blunt so be careful. He wants to make sure you can handle a class so say you will stick to your rules and be on top of cheating.
Interview Questions: In what ways will you show your students that you are in charge?

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: there is nothing that i can talk about. the person who gave the interview ask me to introduce myself, and the software that i can use and that is it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Meet at date and time to be interviewed. I came to the departments main office asked for the relevant person and walked in to be interviewed. The process was an easy one because they are not too strict when it comes to hiring student workers. You must maintain a GPA of 3.0 and be a full-time student to be eligible.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work part time?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kean University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I came into the office, he asked me if I could do computer stuff. I can. Hired. Yay. I don't know what else to say that was literally it can I please move on now?
Interview Questions: Do you know how to use microsoft office?

title: Audio Visual Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with supervisor. Are you a team player? and when would I be able to start? Interview was short and straight to the point. Very easy and friendly as well
Interview Questions: Are you a team player?

title: Director Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The Interviews I had was with two people the Assistant Dean  of College of Business at Kean and the Director of The Office of Internship. One meeting and they decided that day to hire me.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I was flexible enough to work and to train.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Questions involving the department and job duties from the department head. Will let you know if you received the job and introduce you to your colleagues and supervisors. after you will receive your schedule and you report in and will be given your duties. Certain departments have training days.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a series of interviews with a panel and then with the director of the department. The interview was brief but direct, the questions were fair. Comfortable &timely
Interview Questions: why would you like to work here?

title: Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Three MSC workers will interview you at the same time reading off of pre selected questions. Two of them will be current student workers, and the other interviewer will be a GA or a professional staff member.  If hired, you will hear back from them within 2-3 weeks. 

Prior to going in to your interview, you will need to fill out an application which takes about 10 minutes- so make sure you show up at least 15 minutes early.
Interview Questions:
What do you like most about the MSC?
What is unique about you?
How have you handled tough situations?

title: Academic Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application in May 2012. I received a call from them in March 2013. I interview with them the next week. I was hired that day. I started working 2 weeks after that.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working in an office?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: In my case, there wasn't a formal interview process, as I was a former student, and known to members of the department. An opportunity opened up to cover one section of a course, and a member of the departments invited my to apply. My academic background was known, and I had previous teaching experience.
Interview Questions: Are you interested, and available to teach this course? (I had previous experience in the subject matter)

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kean University (Union, NJ) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview by Dept Chair
Interview Questions: Would you take more than five classes?
